Kerja Sama Pemkot Tasikmalaya, Pertamina Resmikan Kampung Batik
01 Nov 2019, 21:58 by Adinda Purnama Rachmani
Jakarta -
PT Pertamina (Persero) Marketing Operation Region III bersinergi dengan Pemerintah Kota (Pemkot) Tasikmalaya meresmikan Kampung Batik Bright Gas di Kecamatan Cipedes, Tasikmalaya. Lokasi ini merupakan pengembangan sentra batik di Tasikmalaya yang sudah diinisiasi oleh Pemkot.
Ditempat ini, Pertamina mendukung pembangunan Gapura Sentra Batik Tugu Neon Box dan peta informasi sentra pengrajin batik untuk memperkuat ikon kampung batik yang dikenal dengan corak 'Merak Ngibing'.
Wali Kota Tasikmalaya Budi Budiman mengatakan sinergi antara pemerintah daerah dengan Badan Usaha Milik Negara (BUMN) dalam memajukan potensi pariwisata perlu didukung untuk memajukan usaha kecil menengah. Untuk menggali potensi lain di pusat ekonomi kreatif di daerah, guna mendorong kemandirian ekonomi masyarakat.
"Kami memberikan apresiasi kepada Pertamina yang telah mendukung pengembangan sentra batik di Tasikmalaya. Sejalan dengan upaya Pemda untuk penggunaan LPG subsidi yang tepat sasaran. Kami berharap gerakan Bright Gas semacam ini bisa berlanjut ke bidang lain, di antaranya kuliner dan makanan olahan," ucap Budi Budiman,dalam keterangan tertulis, Jumat (1/11/2019).
Selanjutnya General Manager Pertamina Marketing Operation Region III Tengku Fernanda memberikan apresiasi kepada pemerintah kota Tasikmalaya dan juga pengrajin batik yang turut mendukung inisiasi Kampung Batik Bright Gas sebagai lokasi wisata yang ikonik.
Penamaan Kampung Batik Bright Gas juga merupakan wujud kesadaran 'penguasa' batik, yang sudah beralih menggunakan LPG nonsubsidi Bright Gas. Sehingga LPG subsidi 3 kilogram bisa digunakan tepat sasaran untuk masyarakat prasejahtera dan usaha mikro.
Sebelumnya ada 25 pengrajin di Sentra Batik Tasikmalaya yang telah melakukan trade in Bright Gas dengan tabung LPG subsidi 3 kilogram secara gratis.
Pada Januari-September 2019 konsumsi LPG nonsubsidi di wilayah Priangan Timur seperti Kota Tasikmalaya, Kabupaten Tasikmalaya, Ciamis. Pangandaran, Banjar, dan Garut mencapai 10.016 Metrik ton (MT). Sehingga LPG 3 kilogram diharapkan bisa digunakan secara tepat sasaran.
"Kami berharap langkah ini bisa menular ke industri dan UKM lainnya, dan kami terus mempermudah akses pengrajin mendapatkan LPG nonsubsidi, di mana telah kami siapkan juga pangkalan-pangkalan LPG yang menyediakan Bright Gas di sekitar Kampung Batik yang bisa dipesan antar," ucapnya Fernanda.
Pertamina juga mendukung kemajuan UKM dan industri kreatif di Tasikmalaya, melalui program kemitraan yaitu pemberian pinjaman modal bergulir dari BUMN bagi usaha kecil. Sebagai bagian dari tugas BUMN untuk membantu pengembangan usaha kecil.
Saat ini ada sekitar 156 usaha kecil menengah menjadi mitra binaan Pertamina dari berbagai sektor seperti perdagangan, pertenakan, industri kreatif, perikanan dan lainnya di Tasikmalaya.

text:
Cooperation between Tasikmalaya City Government, Pertamina Inaugurates Kampung Batik
Nov 01 2019, 21:58 by Adinda Purnama Rachmani
Jakarta -
PT Pertamina (Persero) Marketing Operation Region III in synergy with the City Government (Pemkot) of Tasikmalaya inaugurated Batik Bright Gas Village in Cipedes Subdistrict, Tasikmalaya. This location is the development of a batik center in Tasikmalaya that has been initiated by the City Government.
In this place, Pertamina supports the construction of the Tugu Neon Box Batik Center Gate and the batik map center information center to strengthen the batik village icon known as the 'Merib Ngibing' style.
Mayor of Tasikmalaya Budi Budiman said the synergy between the regional government and the State-Owned Enterprises (BUMN) in advancing tourism potential needs to be supported to advance small and medium businesses. To explore other potentials at the center of the creative economy in the region, in order to foster community economic independence.
"We appreciate Pertamina for supporting the development of batik centers in Tasikmalaya. In line with the local government's efforts to use LPG subsidies on target. We hope that the Bright Gas movement can continue into other fields, including culinary and processed foods," Budi said Budiman, in a written statement, Friday (11/01/2019).
Furthermore, the General Manager of Pertamina Marketing Operation Region III Tengku Fernanda expressed his appreciation to the Tasikmalaya city government and also batik artisans who also supported the initiation of the Bright Gas Batik Village as an iconic tourist site.
The naming of the Bright Gas Batik Village is also a form of awareness of the 'ruler' of batik, who has switched to using the Bright Gas non-subsidized LPG. So that the 3-kilogram subsidized LPG can be used right on target for underprivileged communities and microbusinesses.
Previously there were 25 craftsmen at the Tasikmalaya Batik Center who had traded in Bright Gas with a 3-kilogram subsidized LPG cylinder for free.
In January-September 2019 the consumption of non-subsidized LPG in the East Priangan region such as the City of Tasikmalaya, Tasikmalaya Regency, Ciamis. Pangandaran, Banjar, and Garut reached 10,016 metric tons (MT). So that the 3-kilogram LPG is expected to be used on target.
"We hope this step can spread to other industries and SMEs, and we continue to facilitate craftsmen access to get non-subsidized LPG, where we have also set up LPG bases that provide Bright Gas around Batik Village which can be ordered between," he said.
Pertamina also supports the progress of SMEs and creative industries in Tasikmalaya, through a partnership program that is providing revolving capital loans from SOEs for small businesses. As part of the task of SOEs to help the development of small businesses.
At present there are about 156 small and medium businesses that are Pertamina's foster partners from various sectors such as trade, animal husbandry, creative industries, fisheries and others in Tasikmalaya.
